intro: Secamone marsupiata, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
